isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Engine Electrical - Removal - ECM, IDM, EGR Drive Module, and Intake Air Heater

svcproc.title: ECM, IDM, EGR Drive Module, and Intake Air Heater

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, disconnect the main negative battery terminal before removing or installing any electrical components.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, make sure the key is in the OFF position before unplugging the connector or relay for the ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module. Failure to turn the key to the OFF position will cause a voltage spike and damage the electrical components.

To avoid engine damage, do not tug on any wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free up any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

figure.caption: ECM, IDM, EGR drive module, and tube assembly overview

para.title: Disconnecting the sensor wiring harness at the drive modules.

step1.para: Disconnect the ICP connector from the valve cover connection.
Disconnect the EGR drive module.
Disconnect the IDM connector.
Disconnect two ECM chassis connectors.
Disconnect two intake air heater relay connectors.
Disconnect the CKP sensor.
Disconnect two ECM engine connectors.

para.title: Injector wiring harness at ECM and IDM drive modules

step1.para: Disconnect six injector connectors from the valve cover gasket.
Disconnect the injector shield ground stud connection.
Disconnect two IDM connectors.
Disconnect two ECM engine connectors.
Disconnect two ECM chassis connectors.

para.title: Intake Air Heater Wiring Harness Assembly

step1.para: Disconnect intake air heater cable at starter solenoid.

figure.caption: Intake air heater and relay wiring harness

calloutgroup.callout1: Intake air heater wiring harness tie downs
Intake air heater mounting nut stud bolts (2)
Intake air heater and relay bracket mounting bolt

step1.para: Remove two intake air heater mounting nuts under boot protectors.
Pull up on intake air heater wiring harness to disengage two tie down locations from ECM / IDM bracket.

calloutgroup.callout1: Heater relay bracket bolt, M6 x 20 and nut, M6

step1.para: Remove two intake air heater mounting nuts (M6) and heater relay bracket bolt (M6 x 20) and nut (M6).
Remove intake air heater bracket with harness assembly.

note.para: Heater relay bracket and heater wiring harness are removed as an assembly. There is no need to disconnect the air heater wiring harness connectors from the air heater relays.

figure.caption: ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module assembly (side view)

step1.para: Remove two module assembly to engine mounting stud bolts on right side (M8 x 45/19).
Remove two module assembly mounting bolts on left side (M8 x 45).

figure.caption: ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module assembly

step1.para: Remove module assembly.

note.para: The ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module can be removed as a single unit and disassembled on a workbench, or they can be replaced individually on the engine. It will be disassembled on a workbench for illustrative purposes.

figure.caption: EGR drive module, IDM, and ECM assembly

step1.para: Remove two bolts (M6 x 16) securing EGR drive module to the ECM / IDM bracket and lift off.
Remove four bolts (M8 x 40) securing the ECM / IDM bracket to both modules then remove bracket.
Both IDM and ECM modules can now be separated.
